active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the challenges of balancing strict ISO 27001:2022 Annex A 8.24 compliance (e.g., legal cryptography restrictions) with practical security needs in a global organization handling sensitive data. Provide examples of trade-offs and propose solutions.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in ISO/IEC 27001:2022 standards. Generate 50 high-quality flashcards on 'ISO/IEC 27001:2022 Annex A 8.24 (Use of Cryptography)' in the topic hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security Architecture And Engineering > Cryptographic Solutions > Standards, Compliance, and Governance > ISO/IEC Cryptographic Standards > ISO/IEC 27001:2022 Annex A 8.24. Incorporate: - Learning objectives: [INSERT FULL LIST FROM learning_objectives] - Active learning: Weave in prompts from [discussion_prompt, peer_teaching_activity, problem_solving_exercise] into back explanations. - Scaffolding: Distribute flashcards across 4 layers [INSERT FULL SCAFFOLDING DETAILS]; tag each with layer. - Prior knowledge: Assume familiarity with CIA triad and basic ISO 27001 from entry domains. - Content completeness: Cover definitions (cryptography, CIA+authenticity), policy/key management, risk assessment/data classification, implementation steps, comparisons (2022 vs 2013), best practices (algorithms, training, auditing), integration (other controls, post-quantum, ISMS fit for certification, breach prevention). - Research: Base on ISO 27001:2022 (replaces 2013 A10.1.1/10.1.2), ISO 27002:2022 guidelines, isms.online. Follow flashcard schema exactly [INSERT FULL FLASHCARD_SCHEMA]. Output ONLY a JSON array of 50 flashcards. Ensure university-level pedagogy: active recall, spaced repetition friendly, distractors challenge misconceptions.
